oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic controls in Germany – is there a need to harmonize?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zorn, Alexander
Lippert, Christian
Dabbert, Stephan
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Values, standards and certification
Germany
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic food markets substantially rely on a reliable control system. To identify and isolate the effect of different factors potentially influencing the uniform implementation of organic controls, we apply a stepwise estimation of different logit models. Using control data of German farms from five important control bodies we identify, first, risk factors for non-compliance of farms, second, the impact of the control body as well as, third, the potential impact of governmental institutions which are in charge for the implementation of the control system. The results indicate a need for a more harmonized implementation of the German organic control system.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Zorn, Alexander; Lippert, Christian and Dabbert, Stephan (2014) Organic controls in Germany – is there a need to harmonize? Poster at: EAAE 2014 Congress ‘Agri-Food and Rural Innovations for Healthier Societies’, Ljubljana, Slovenia, 26.-29. August 2014.
